spanGrp.span: ‘That child stood up to dance with the bear.
Je yaba jẽk kagá klötiö je oso ra
He asked him to do something and to scratch his back with a stick.
Jamẽ í pakká-ite jirö wa jemẽ teki biö kal mẽ nẽ
the child does the same things that the bear does,
jie të jirö wẽ-gẽ jebi yaba të jirö wẽ bi
such as putting the banana into his mouth or play in the river.
je (_) chomõ pakkö-wã' í kakwö nã nẽ jinõ diglö inga
They played a lot in the river;
Jebi jie-wa jinã' kulo diglö nã
the child fell on the bear’s belly,
Jebi yaba janã-mĩ jie ñãwa inga
scratched him and made him laugh
të jie bie-gẽ të jie jeñẽ wẽ-gẽ (_)
and then they kept playing a lot in the river.’
Jemẽ í menẽũ-lo diglö nã jinã' kulo rö
